page.title: 15SECTION 7 + SECTION 8
page.content:
LOCAL HISTORY - Hodgson's Hill which is protected as an Ancient Monument COMMUNICATION - The Lakeside road through this section terminates at Sandwick in Martindale and the only public transport is the post bus which runs twice daily. It is a Mini Bus/ Mail Van which collects and delivers mail to the remote parts of Martindale LAND COVER - ll = grassland. l9=water AMENITIES - 0l = ll. 02 = l9. 67 = Post Bus to Martindale
SECTION 8 - WEST SHORE OF ULLSWATER LAND COVER - ll & l2. 2/3 used for hay, cattle & sheep grazing. l6 = The moorland, which is common land, used by farmers having land adjoining. AMENITIES - 0l = ll. 3 cottages occupied by non-farming families.
